file_content.text: Stay back. If you come too close, I'm dead. If I move, I'm dead.
He was close by. Wanted to watch the destruction. When it didn't happen, he came here. The Shroud. You didn't kill him.
Ganging up against a single man. Not terribly sporting. I approve.
Hello again, Master Jedi. I do hope you're well rested after slashing your way across the galaxy.
It's been too long since I last matched wits with a master Jedi like yourself. I forgot how exhilarating it can be.
Major. I had hoped to one day see General Rakton's bane in action. You did not disappoint. Well done.
Ah, Captain. Much more resourceful than I expected--even from the privateer who bested the Voidwolf.
You put a stop to my most ambitious plan to date. I have to say, I'm impressed.
I hope you enjoyed fighting my double. Not nearly as formidable as the genuine article, but I feel he played his part quite well.
You've already lost, Shroud. There's nothing to be gained in threatening the agent's life.
It's over. Now let her go.
By revealing yourself now, you lose everything that having a double afforded you.
You tip your hand.
No, that's where you're wrong, Jedi.
Don't be a sore loser, Shroud. Let the agent go.
You lost. Get over it.
I might--but it all depends on you, Major.
The old stand-in trick. I'd use it myself, but I can't find anyone nearly good looking enough.
Sneaky, sneaky.
A curious time to make light, Captain, when you hold an associate's life in your hands.
What do you want with Riss?
What's your game?
Nothing. Nothing at all. It's what I want from you.
You hide behind doubles and holos. What's wrong--too afraid to face me?
Face me, coward.
Not a student of espionage, I see.
My double possessed some data he shouldn't have. It's as though everyone's an ungrateful thief these days.
You will now wipe the data clean via Riss's console. Do so, and I'll let Special Agent Riss live. I am monitoring the console, so no tricks.
No. Don't. Whatever that data is, it's damaging enough for him to stick his neck out after faking his death.
Plug it into the console--but upload the data into the SIS secure system instead. Do it. Don't think about me--not for one second.
[Destroy the data]
There. The data's all yours, Shroud. Now do as you promised.
I may be a professional back-stabber, but I am also a man of my word.
The collar--it's powered down. It's over.
Oh, but it's never truly over is it? I'm still alive. Still planning. And now I've found a new challenge. Or rather--a new challenger.
Oh, but it's never truly over is it? I'm still alive. Still planning. And now I've found a new challenge. Or rather--new challengers.
So long as there are brave souls like Deena Riss willing to sacrifice everything to stop you, all you can do is count the days until you're caught.
You'll never win.
Nobility and justice and fluffy clouds. You should see by now that none of that matters to me.
I'm not your arch nemesis. You're someone who deserves to be brought to justice--nothing more.
This isn't personal.
You disappoint me. Ah, but you'll come around.
You want an enemy? You got one--but you'll come to wish you never crossed me.
Game on, Shroud.
We'll detonate that bridge when we come to it.
Score one to you for saving Galactic City from the greatest plot of mass destruction ever conceived--but this game's only just begun. I'll see you around.
So many agents died to get us this far. We could have had him! And now....
No. You know what? You saved the Republic capital from utter destruction. You did the noble thing, and--I'll say it, I'm glad to be alive.
You're a credit to the SIS. They couldn't afford to lose you.
You deserve nothing less.
Hearing that means more to me than you know.
How about we celebrate? Hit the cantina, maybe somewhere more private?
[Flirt] Go for a drink?
That actually sounds great... but I've probably got several weeks of briefings and report filings in my immediate future. Sorry.
You're on borrowed time now. Make the most of it.
Don't blow your second chance.
I've been on borrowed time for quite a while already. I don't ever waste it.
Thank you--for everything. And keep the macrobinoculars. You'll most likely need them again.
[Upload the data]
Your sacrifice won't be forgotten, Special Agent Riss.
I did not think you had it in you. I'd be impressed--if I wasn't so damned infuriated!
You think you've won. But those files are heavily encrypted, and you're down one more SIS agent.
SIS will eventually crack your encryption. And more brave people will rise up to replace Deena Riss and stand in the way of madmen like you.
You'll never win.
I not only expect to find resistance; I'm counting on it.
Let's just skip to the end of all this to the part where you're brought to justice. What do you say?
Turn yourself in.
And deprive us of the great chase? No, I don't think so.
You're not the only one willing to cross lines, Shroud. You may want to sleep with a blaster from here on out.
I'm coming for you.
You're assuming I don't do that already--or that I even sleep.
I wanted a grand challenge. Laying waste to Galactic City didn't work out, but now I've found a new challenge. Or rather--a new challenger.
I wanted a grand challenge. Laying waste to Galactic City didn't work out, but now I've found a new challenge. Or rather--new challengers.
I concede this turn, but the game isn't nearly over. Do enjoy my macrobinoculars. I'll see you around.
Woo! You did it! We're safe! Galactic City is safe.
Looks like you've found a little something extra there, too. Huh. Never seen encryption like that. Be sure to bring it along for your debrief.
Wow. I guess the Shroud won't be gumming up the works anymore. Surprised he didn't try to slip away....
What am I babbling about? Hurry--power down the hyperspace beacon before that dreadnaught plows into Galactic City!
This one had schematics for a hyperspace beacon. And part of a message...? I--I don't believe it.
He's planted a hyperspace beacon inside Galactic City! That remote-pilot dreadnaught, he plans to pull it out of hyperspace inside Coruscant's defenses! He's going to crash it!
Millions will die! We'll get searching for the beacon but there's so little time. You'll have to find the Shroud and shut it down manually.
All those calls he made to you--I was able to triangulate his general position. Please, hurry! Stop that ship from taking out Galactic City!
You're making me long for the days of being a field agent. Tracked down another lieutenant's data hub. We're good to go.
You're really making short work of the Shroud's best people. He's gotta be fuming right now. Let's see what we can find in here....
It's a manual for a remote piloting system. That would be for the dreadnaught. But he can't be sending it to Coruscant; planetary defenses would blow it to space dust.
Something's not adding up here and we're running out of time to do the math. Well--let's hunt down the next set of relays.
I keep wondering what kind of person would potentially kill millions just to do it. It's so utterly insane....
Sorry. Thinking out loud again. I've got the coordinates of another lieutenant. You're doing great. Carry on.
Nice work. Am I glad I got you to help out. Okay, transmission received....
Wow. The Shroud bought a dreadnaught. He's rich, but there's no way he could afford to staff it up. Maybe he's... storing something on it?
Sorry, just thinking out loud. I got some new relay coordinates off the data. We're still on track. Keep it up.
My agents haven't found anything suspicious on Coruscant, but they'll keep looking.
Good news is, you've given me enough to triangulate another lieutenant. You'll have to pinpoint the exact location yourself, but I have total faith. Riss out.
And from all that I'm able to triangulate.... Hold on.... There. That's where you'll find the Shroud's lieutenant. Go to it.
That won't help us triangulate anything--but, you know, that is one of the Shroud's spy droids. Keep an eye out for more of those--they'll be worth tracking.
There you go. That's just what we're looking for. Good work.
Hey, I just had some credible intel come in. Coordinates uploaded. Let's check it out.
You really need to be out finding the Shroud.
Thanks for coming here to meet me. I'm afraid I'm not quite as mobile as I used to be. Shrapnel will do that.
We've... been losing agents lately. A lot of talented agents. I have nowhere else to turn, so I hope you can help.
A galactic legend's been brought out of retirement--a freelance master spy known only as "The Shroud."
"The Shroud?"
In all my travels, I've never heard of this "legend." What can you tell me about him?
He's been underground so long that he was barely a whisper when I was in the academy. I think that's by design.
I take it by the codename that this legend's specialty lies in remaining concealed. Makes me wonder if he's even real.
I thought he was just a myth back when I was in the academy. But he's real, all right.
I'm not up on my spy lore, so I'll take your word on the whole "legend" thing.
No, I wouldn't have expected you to have heard of him. He dropped off the map before I even joined the academy.
Can't be much of a legend if I never heard of him.
He disappeared so long ago that by the time I joined the academy we really believed he was just a myth.
I'm more interested in the spy standing in front of me now.
[Flirt] Who cares about him?
You're very kind, but I'm afraid this problem is far more important right now.
How is a single spy taking out SIS agents and threatening the Republic?
He's only one man.
He isn't just a spy--he's the spy, even after years of laying low.
The Shroud came back into SIS chatter after the Hutt Cartel contracted him to gather intel on Republic and Imperial interests.
In his spying, the Shroud found something beyond what the Hutts were looking for. A challenge he could undertake. A weakness he could exploit--on Coruscant.
You make it sound like this isn't personal to him--almost like it's a game.
A challenge?
Word is the Shroud doesn't act out of morality at all, but out of achievement. The more audacious, the better.
After everything we went through on Makeb, the Hutts are still plotting against us?
Isn't the Cartel our ally now?
First the Cartel invades Makeb, and now they're targeting the Republic directly?
The Hutts are behind this?
The Cartel commissioned the Shroud in their lead-up to Makeb--but only to spy. They want no part in the Shroud's plan.
A "weakness." A "challenge." Some specific information would be nice.
This is all rather vague.
We don't know the exact nature of his attack on Coruscant, except that one of his top lieutenants reportedly resigned over its severity. Fled to the Empire.
I'm good at what I do--really good--but all this is so overwhelming. I need your help to stop the Shroud.
I'm no spy. I'd like your assistance in the field.
I'll need your help, too.
Me? In the field? Not since a sabotaged astromech exploded into my leg....
I understand this has been a trial, but you have to keep going.
Be strong.
I have no intention of quitting. I'll be with you every step--figuratively, at least.
Sounds like I'll be doing your job for you.
You're the spy, not me.
You'll be helping me save Coruscant from mass destruction. But don't worry, I'll be playing my role as well.
One of our departed agents managed to intercept a shipment of the Shroud's. In it were several pairs of souped-up macrobinoculars.
I've got budget envy. Data and environmental analysis, communications, even a special Miraluka interface.... Shroud spent a fortune on these things--which, ironically, you'll be using against him.
Anything to make this madman's failure more likely, whether it be the Force or gadgetry.
May technology guide me.
Good. But don't be too quick to dismiss the Shroud as mad. He's highly intelligent.
Like most schemers, his own dark endeavors will become his undoing.
His ambition betrays him.
Let's not get ahead of ourselves. Even stripped of everything, he's still a formidable threat.
Every little edge helps. Tell me where to go with these binocs and I'll bring him back in binders.
Another tool in the kit. Good.
Even if it were that easy to get to the Shroud, you'd want to be careful. He's no slouch.
I just hope I get to see the look on his face right up and close when he realizes he's busted.
I do enjoy irony.
I wouldn't be so eager to be anywhere near the Shroud. From all accounts, he's no pushover.
How will a pair of binoculars help me avert a massive attack?
How so?
I don't need fancy toys.
The Force is my guide. I have no need for trinkets.
I mean no disrespect, but unless the Force can recognize discrete data packets and send them to me, you will need this trinket.
I'm sure you've seen my jacket. Have I ever had trouble tracking anyone down before?
Your stats are impressive, Major, but these are highly-trained covert operatives. Without these macrobinoculars, they're ghosts to you.
Come on--look who you're talking to. I always know the best hiding spots. I won't need binoculars.
We aren't looking for contraband inside a freighter, Captain. This is far more complicated.
The Shroud's data is scattered among his lieutenants. We've got a lead on one, but you'll need to identify key relay points that will help us triangulate his precise location.
I'll remain in constant contact, monitoring your incoming data to keep up with your progress. Working together, I know we can stop the Shroud. Good luck.
Hi. Sorry I can't talk; I'm really busy right now.
Great work, stopping the Shroud's plan. Thank you.
